Description.val:
Budget Line Item (BLI) 0575 Aviation Life Support Mods contains OSIP 003-19 for Physiological Episodes (PE) and this is a continuation of efforts previously funded in BLI 0525 F/A-18 Series and BLI 0569 T-45 Series. 

This line item funds Aircraft Integration Modifications for the Enhanced Visual Acuity (EVA) program for all USN/USMC Rotary Wing and Tilt Rotor Aircraft and Aircrew Oxygen System related modifications for Physiological Episode (PE) program for fixed wing aircraft. This line item will also be utilized for future Aviation Life Support Modifications as required.

Justification.val: This budget request supports OSIP 003-19 starting in FY19 to support Physiological Episodes and OSIP 004-21 starting in FY21 to support Enhanced Visual Acuity (EVA) Aircraft Integration Modifications.  The FY 2019 funding request was reduced by $0.789M to reflect the Department of Navy's effort to support the Office of Management and Budget directed reforms for Efficiency and Effectiveness that include a lean, accountable, more efficient government.

Name.@footnote: Increase in FY19 to FY20 due to both T-45 and F-18 ramping up production. FY22 and FY23 support for follow-on production verification assessment of on-aircraft Physiological Monitoring  systems.
Increase in FY19 to FY20 due to both T-45 and F-18 ramping up production. FY22 and FY23 support for follow-on production verification assessment of on-aircraft Physiological Monitoring  systems.

Description.val:
DESCRIPTION JUSTIFICATION:  Oxygen System Upgrades incorporates Aircrew Oxygen System related modifications to all USN/USMC fixed wing aircraft.  Oxygen systems include OBOGS (On-Board Oxygen Generation System), OBIGS (On-Board Inert Gas Generation System), regulators and Oxygen Storage Bottles.

Current modifications address the alarming increase in Physiological Episodes (hypoxia and decompression sickness events). This is the #1 Commander, Naval Air Force (CNAF) priority and CNATRA (Chief of Naval Air Training) Safety Issue. OBOGS (On-Board Oxygen Generation System) hardware improvements have been qualified to address aging system deficiencies and are being fielded.

Model.val: AH-1Z, CH-53E/K, MH-53E, MH-60R, MH-60S, MV-22B, UH-1Y

ImplementationMethodName.val: Contractor Field Team:: Installation Name: Enhanced Visual Acuity

Description.val: DESCRIPTION JUSTIFICATION:  Enhanced Visual Acuity (EVA) is a digital replacement for the AN/AVS-9 Aviator Night Vision goggles for all USN/USMC Rotary Wing and Tilt Rotor Aircraft.  The system will provide increased resolution under reduced light levels and serve as the display for aircraft Heads Up Display (HUD) systems.  APN-5 funding will be utilized for aircraft modifications required to provide electrical power and HUD symbology for the EVA system.
